kexp.base.sub.dealer module

class kexp.base.sub.dealer.Dealer[source]

Bases: object

repeat_xvars(N_repeats=[])[source]

For each xvar in the scan_xvars list, replaces xvar.values with np.repeat(xvar.values,self.params.N_repeats).

Parameters:

  • (int/list/ndarray (N_repeats)

  • optional) (The number of repeats to be)

  • of (implemented. Can be omitted to use the stored value)

  • one (self.params.N_repeats. Must be either int or list/array of length)

:param : :param or a list/array with one element per element of self.xvarnames.:

shuffle_xvars(sort_preshuffle=True)[source]

For each attribute of self.params with key specified in self.xvarnames, replaces the corresponding array with a shuffled version of that array. The shuffle orders are stored in self.sort_idx to be used in re-sorting derived arrays.

Example: self.xvarnames = [‘t_tof’]. User specifies self.params.t_tof = [4.,6.,8.]. This function might rewrite-in-place self.params.t_tof = [8.,4.,6.], and record self.sort_idx = [3,1,2].

Parameters:

  • sort_preshuffle (bool, optional) – If True, each xvar will be sorted

  • shuffled (so that its elements are sequential before being)

  • that (such)

  • un-shuffled (when)

  • True. (the elements are in order. Defaults to)

abs_image()[source]
fl_image(t=-1.0, with_light=True)[source]
get_N_img()[source]

Computes the number of images to be taken during the sequence from the length of the specified xvars, stores in self.params.N_img. For absorption imaging, 3 images per shot. For fluorescence imaging, 2 images per shot.

pulse_D1_beams(t)[source]

Sets D1 GM beams to resonance and turns them on for time t.

Parameters:

t (float) – Time (in seconds) to hold the resonant MOT beams on.

pulse_imaging_light(t)[source]
pulse_resonant_mot_beams(t)[source]

Sets D2 3D MOT beams to resonance and turns them on for time t.

Parameters:

t (float) – Time (in seconds) to hold the resonant MOT beams on.

set_high_field_imaging(i_outer, imaging_amp=-10000000000.0)[source]
set_imaging_detuning(detuning=-10000000000.0, amp=-10000000000.0)[source]

Sets the detuning of the beat-locked imaging laser (in Hz).

Imaging detuning is controlled by two things – the Vescent offset lock and a double pass (-1 order).

The offset lock has a multiplier, N, that determines the offset lock frequency relative to the lock point of the D2 laser locked at the crossover feature for the D2 transition. Offset = N * reference freqeuency.

The reference frequency is provided by a DDS channel (dds_frame.beatlock_ref).

trigger_camera()[source]

Written to pretrigger camera such that the camera exposure begins at the timeline cursor position where this is called. Returns the timeline cursor to this position after pretrigger.

kexp.base.sub.scanner module

class kexp.base.sub.scanner.Scanner[source]

Bases: object

cleanup_scanned()[source]

Sets the parameters in ExptParams to the lists that were used to take the data.

These are put in in the order the data was taken – no unshuffling is done.

This is good for recordkeeping, and ensures backward compatability with analysis code.

fetch_array(i)[source]

Returns the value of the ith experiment parameter with datatype ndarray.

  • self._param_keylist_arrays.

generate_assignment_kernels()[source]

Generates a list of kernel functions for each param datatype (int32, int64, ndarray, and float ) – one for each ExptParam attribute. These can be called in the kernel to update the kernel experiment params with values from the host ExptParams returned by an RPC (the “fetch” functions).

init_scan_kernel()[source]

This method is run between each shot just before scan_kernel.

logspace(start, end, n)[source]
new_param_check(xvar)[source]
param_police(xvar)[source]
pre_scan()[source]

This method is run in scan before the scan loop.

scan()[source]

Runs the scan_kernel function for each value of the xvars specified.

The xvars are scanned as if looping over nested for loops, with the last xvar as the innermost loop.

On each step of the scan, the host ExptParams is updated with the next values of the xvars and derived parameters are recomputed. Then, the updated host ExptParams values are written into the corresponding kernel ExptParams.

scan_kernel()[source]

The kernel function to be scanned in the experiment.

It should correspond to a single “shot” (single set of images to generate one OD).

The scan kernel should accept no arguments.

Any parameters being scanned should be referenced in the scan kernel as an attribute of the experiment parameters attribute of the experiment class.

step_scan(idx=0)[source]

Advances the counters of the xvars to the next step in the scan.

Advances counters as if the xvars were looped over in nested for loops, with the last xvar being the innermost loop.

update_nvars()[source]

Updates the number of xvars to be scanned.

update_params_from_xvars()[source]

Updates the host ExptParams attributes and recomputes derived parameters according to the current values of the scanned xvars.

Does not update the values of the kernel ExptParams – to do so, use write_host_params_to_kernel().

write_host_params_to_kernel()[source]

Loops over all experiment params, and assigns the values of the kernel ExptParam attributes to those of the of the host ExptParam attributes.

Must have run generate_assignment_kernels() in build first.

xvar(key, values)[source]

Adds an xvar to the experiment.

Parameters:

  • key (str) – The key of the ExptParams attribute to scan.

  • values (ndarray) – Values to scan over. Can be n-dimensional, scan will step over first index.
